Keywords: Animal , Brute , Deity , Mystical , Warrior
Real Name: None
Special Powers
ACQUIRING THE STRENGTH OF MY ENEMIES: First Born starts the game on click #4. // Steal Energy. When he uses it, he instead heals 1 click for each action token on a hit target and may heal past his starting line.
GIANT RETALIATION: DESCENDING FROM MOUNT OLYMPUS: Phasing/Teleport, Plasticity. // POWER: If no friendly character has been placed this turn, choose an opposing character within 6 squares that attacked First Born or damaged a friendly character since your last turn. Place First Born such that he can make a close attack targeting the chosen character, then do so. If the chosen opposing character has 2 action tokens, after resolutions remove an action token from First Born.
A GIFT FROM A GOD: STOP. Impervious. // At the end of your turn, give each adjacent opposing character an action token. If you can't, deal them 1 penetrating damage instead.
DIVINE AURA: First Born modifies attack and defense +1 for each action token on adjacent opposing characters.
Trade First Born Want First Born

May 2, 2021
Dortmuner
I tried him out on a Mystical theme team today and he is just nasty. Itt was a battle royale, I had Medusa to double token people but rushed her into the fray to keep anyone from picking up an object right when the other guys decided to gang up on me. They took her out, but I never felt the loss. They had plenty of tokens surrounding them just for ganging up on me and attacking him. First vampire dial I've ever had any luck with and I had him on top dial actually wishing they'd knock me off so I could use Quake and target multiple enemies. They kept cranking out bystanders, but I kept not caring because that just put more tokens adjacent to him and bumped his DV to 22 consistently and AV of 14-15 more often than not. The few times they got through they had to contend with my Impervious roll, and then the damage reduction. We were playing to the death, but both opponents conceded before the end. I even forgot to do the token thing at the end of his first round and by the time I remembered it, he'd healed past his starting click onto click 2. Retaliation and Willpower were good for taking a token off of him every now and then to increase his actions. With all the various ways of giving tokens in this set, he is an absolute monster.
